documentation: The Amazon Chime SDK Identity APIs in this section allow software developers to create and manage unique instances of their messaging applications. These APIs provide the overarching framework for creating and sending messages. For more information about the identity APIs, refer to Amazon Chime SDK identity.

CreateAppInstance.documentation:
Creates an Amazon Chime SDK messaging AppInstance under an AWS account. Only SDK messaging customers use this API. CreateAppInstance supports idempotency behavior as described in the AWS API Standard.

identity
CreateAppInstance.name: CreateAppInstance

CreateAppInstanceAdmin.documentation:
Promotes an AppInstanceUser to an AppInstanceAdmin. The promoted user can perform the following actions.

  • ChannelModerator actions across all channels in the AppInstance.

  • DeleteChannelMessage actions.

Only an AppInstanceUser can be promoted to an AppInstanceAdmin role.
CreateAppInstanceAdmin.name: CreateAppInstanceAdmin

CreateAppInstanceUser.documentation: Creates a user under an Amazon Chime AppInstance. The request consists of a unique appInstanceUserId and Name for that user.
CreateAppInstanceUser.name: CreateAppInstanceUser

DeleteAppInstance.documentation: Deletes an AppInstance and all associated data asynchronously.
DeleteAppInstance.name: DeleteAppInstance

DeleteAppInstanceAdmin.documentation: Demotes an AppInstanceAdmin to an AppInstanceUser. This action does not delete the user.
DeleteAppInstanceAdmin.name: DeleteAppInstanceAdmin

ListAppInstanceAdmins.documentation: Returns a list of the administrators in the AppInstance.
ListAppInstanceAdmins.name: ListAppInstanceAdmins

ListAppInstanceUserEndpoints.documentation: Lists all the AppInstanceUserEndpoints created under a single AppInstanceUser.
ListAppInstanceUserEndpoints.name: ListAppInstanceUserEndpoints

ListAppInstances.documentation: Lists all Amazon Chime AppInstances created under a single AWS account.
ListAppInstances.name: ListAppInstances

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags applied to an Amazon Chime SDK identity resource.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

PutAppInstanceRetentionSettings.documentation: Sets the amount of time in days that a given AppInstance retains data.
PutAppInstanceRetentionSettings.name: PutAppInstanceRetentionSettings

RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpoint.documentation: Registers an endpoint under an Amazon Chime AppInstanceUser. The endpoint receives messages for a user. For push notifications, the endpoint is a mobile device used to receive mobile push notifications for a user.
RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpoint.name: RegisterAppInstanceUserEndpoint

TagResource.documentation: Applies the specified tags to the specified Amazon Chime SDK identity resource.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from the specified Amazon Chime SDK identity resource.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateAppInstanceUser.documentation: Updates the details of an AppInstanceUser. You can update names and metadata.
UpdateAppInstanceUser.name: UpdateAppInstanceUser

UpdateAppInstanceUserEndpoint.documentation: Updates the details of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint. You can update the name and AllowMessage values.
UpdateAppInstanceUserEndpoint.name: UpdateAppInstanceUserEndpoint

AppInstance.documentation: The details of an AppInstance, an instance of an Amazon Chime SDK messaging application.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which an AppInstance was created. In epoch milliseconds.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time an AppInstance was last updated. In epoch milliseconds.

AppInstanceArn.documentation: The ARN of the AppInstance for which the user is an administrator.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which an administrator was created.

AppInstanceRetentionSettings.documentation: The details of the data-retention settings for an AppInstance.

ChannelRetentionSettings.documentation: The length of time in days to retain the messages in a channel.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the AppInstanceUser was created.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the AppInstanceUser was last updated.

AppInstanceUserEndpoint.documentation: An endpoint under an Amazon Chime AppInstanceUser that receives messages for a user. For push notifications, the endpoint is a mobile device used to receive mobile push notifications for a user.

AllowMessages.documentation: Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint will receive all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint will receive no messages.

CreatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which an AppInstanceUserEndpoint was created.

EndpointState.documentation:
A read-only field that represents the state of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported values:

  • ACTIVE: The AppInstanceUserEndpoint is active and able to receive messages. When ACTIVE, the EndpointStatusReason remains empty.

  • INACTIVE: The AppInstanceUserEndpoint is inactive and can't receive message. When INACTIVE, the corresponding reason will be conveyed through EndpointStatusReason.

  • INVALID_DEVICE_TOKEN indicates that an AppInstanceUserEndpoint is INACTIVE due to invalid device token

  • INVALID_PINPOINT_ARN indicates that an AppInstanceUserEndpoint is INACTIVE due to an invalid pinpoint ARN that was input through the ResourceArn field.

LastUpdatedTimestamp.documentation: The time at which an AppInstanceUserEndpoint was last updated.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource to which the endpoint belongs.

AllowMessages.documentation: BBoolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint will receive all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint will receive no messages.

EndpointState.documentation: A read-only field that represent the state of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint.

BadRequestException.documentation: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

ChannelRetentionSettings.documentation: The details of the retention settings for a channel.

RetentionDays.documentation: The time in days to retain the messages in a channel.

ConflictException.documentation: The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource.

AppInstanceAdminArn.documentation: The ARN of the administrator of the current AppInstance.

AppInstanceAdmin.documentation: The name and ARN of the admin for the AppInstance.

AppInstanceArn.documentation: The ARN of the of the admin for the AppInstance.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata of the AppInstance. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.

ClientRequestToken.documentation: The token assigned to the user requesting an AppInstance.

Metadata.documentation: The request's metadata. Limited to a 1KB string in UTF-8.

AppInstanceUserArn.documentation: The ARN of the user request being deleted.

AppInstanceAdmin.documentation: The ARN and name of the AppInstanceUser, the ARN of the AppInstance, and the created and last-updated timestamps. All timestamps use epoch milliseconds.

AppInstance.documentation: The ARN, metadata, created and last-updated timestamps, and the name of the AppInstance. All timestamps use epoch milliseconds.

AppInstanceUserEndpoint.documentation: The full details of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint: the AppInstanceUserArn, ID, name, type, resource ARN, attributes, allow messages, state, and created and last updated timestamps. All timestamps use epoch milliseconds.

DeviceToken.documentation: The device token for the GCM, APNS, and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.

VoipDeviceToken.documentation: The VOIP device token for the APNS and APNS_SANDBOX endpoint types.

EndpointState.documentation:
A read-only field that represents the state of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported values:

  • ACTIVE: The AppInstanceUserEndpoint is active and able to receive messages. When ACTIVE, the EndpointStatusReason remains empty.

  • INACTIVE: The AppInstanceUserEndpoint is inactive and can't receive message. When INACTIVE, the corresponding reason will be conveyed through EndpointStatusReason.

  • INVALID_DEVICE_TOKEN indicates that an AppInstanceUserEndpoint is INACTIVE due to invalid device token

  • INVALID_PINPOINT_ARN indicates that an AppInstanceUserEndpoint is INACTIVE due to an invalid pinpoint ARN that was input through the ResourceArn field.

Status.documentation: Enum that indicates the Status of an AppInstanceUserEndpoint.

ForbiddenException.documentation: The client is permanently forbidden from making the request.

InitiateDeletionTimestamp.documentation: The timestamp representing the time at which the specified items are retained, in Epoch Seconds.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of administrators that you want to return.

NextToken.documentation: The token returned from previous API requests until the number of administrators is reached.
The token returned from previous API requests until the number of administrators is reached.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of endpoints that you want to return.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested endpoints are returned.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested endpoints are returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of requests that you want returned.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.
The token passed by previous API calls until all requested users are returned.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of AppInstances that you want to return.

NextToken.documentation: The token passed by previous API requests until you reach the maximum number of AppInstances.
The token passed by previous API requests until the maximum number of AppInstances is reached.

AppInstanceRetentionSettings.documentation: The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.
The time in days to retain data. Data type: number.

InitiateDeletionTimestamp.documentation: The time at which the API deletes data.

AllowMessages.documentation: Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint receives all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint receives no messages.

ClientRequestToken.documentation: The idempotency token for each client request.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the resource to which the endpoint belongs.

Type.documentation:
The type of the AppInstanceUserEndpoint. Supported types:

  • APNS: The mobile notification service for an Apple device.

  • APNS_SANDBOX: The sandbox environment of the mobile notification service for an Apple device.

  • GCM: The mobile notification service for an Android device.

Populate the ResourceArn value of each type as PinpointAppArn.

Tag.documentation: A tag object containing a key-value pair.

ThrottledClientException.documentation: The client exceeded its request rate limit.

UnauthorizedClientException.documentation: The client is not currently authorized to make the request.

Metadata.documentation: The metadata that you want to change.

Name.documentation: The name that you want to change.

AllowMessages.documentation: Boolean that controls whether the AppInstanceUserEndpoint is opted in to receive messages. ALL indicates the endpoint will receive all messages. NONE indicates the endpoint will receive no messages.
